## keys() function

Type-safe wrapper around `Object.keys()` that enhances TypeScript's type inference.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function keys<T>(source: T): ObjectKey<T>[];
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

source


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The object to extract keys from


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[ObjectKey](./type-object.objectkey.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;\[\]

Array of typed keys

## Example 1


```ts
const obj = { a: 1, b: "hello" };

for (const key of keys(obj)) {
  obj[key] // key is "a" | "b"
}
```

## Example 2


```ts
const string = "hello";

for (const key of keys(string)) {
  string[key] // key is number & keyof string
}
```

## Example 3


```ts
const array = [1, 2, 3];

for (const key of keys(array)) {
  array[key] // key is number & keyof array
}
```
